revised_title: The Effect of High-Speed Alternating Stresses on the Fatigue of Metals
tldr: The author develops a high-speed fatigue tester capable of alternating stress at a rate of over 7000 per minute, discovering that the endurance of mild steel is greater at higher speeds. This opens up a new field of investigation in fatigue testing, with implications for reducing testing time and improving understanding of material behavior under rapid stress changes.
